text: Black Tower Authority Level %+n: Region Unlocked
[[col:yellow]]Grants a random follower or banner every %n turns.
Construction Cost: %+n% for each [[col:yellow]]Industry[[/col]] seat seized in the Black Tower of the Witch King.
Magic Winds Reserve: %+n for each [[col:yellow]]Sorcery[[/col]] seat occupied in the Black Tower of the Witch King.
Upkeep: %+n% for each [[col:yellow]]Military[[/col]] seat seized in the Black Tower of the Witch King.

Dark Power from Confederation: %+n per turn

Dark Power represents your capital for seizing power in the Black Tower of Naggarond.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]][[img:icon_ghs_def_black_tower_rule]][[/img]]Dark Power can be gained from constructing buildings, faction mechanics, characters, and confederations. It can also be converted into slave resources via Slave Orders.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]][[img:icon_ghs_def_black_tower_rule]][[/img]]In the Black Tower at the heart of Naggarond, Dark Power can be spent to gain powerful rewards.[[/col]]
We need Dark Power! Crush those insolent fools in the Black Tower of the Witch King!
We must maintain control over the slaves. Slow the pace of conquest in the Black Tower for now.
The Black Tower of the Witch King

The Black Tower of the Witch King rises at the center of Naggarond, a labyrinth of palaces, walls, and spires that brings wealth and prestige to its owner. The Witch King is an unpredictable ruler, generous when fortune smiles, but unrelenting and brutal when plans falter.
Some indolent Dreadlords die wondering which audacious rebels dared to strike them down!
Defeated foes, regardless of rank, are stripped bare and sent to mines, often revealing unexpected treasures.
Thinking what I am thinking? The slave pens are almost empty! For the joy of all Druchii, let the blood flow today!
There is no such thing as too many slaves. Mines eternally demand laborers, and the Witch King’s grand plans consume vast resources.
The feeling of slicing through defenses, slitting throats, and stabbing hearts is so delightful!
Swift and decisive strikes are key to conquest, and only this seat holds the resources necessary to sustain the army's advance.
The one holding the armory’s keys is the most trusted by the Dreadlord, though that trust invites constant scrutiny.
In response to the Black Tower Lord's call, warriors gather from all directions.
On the Tower of Prophecy in Ghrond, sorceresses of the Dark Convent study vile Chaos magic. This power is potent enough to disrupt the Great Vortex.
Those who can manipulate the Winds of Magic to serve the Witch King's interests achieve elevated positions—though under increased scrutiny.
For the Druchii, the scent of agony is like the finest perfume, and nothing sounds more despairing than the twisted prophecies of Medusa Prophets.
Spells forged with Dhar, or raw dark magic, are among the most destructive. These are drawn from unrefined Winds of Magic but exact a terrible price on their users.
Slave master, whip wielder, and the direct source of Black Tower lords' taxation revenues.
The massive holds of the Black Arks carry slaves, destined for Naggarond or to serve their cruel masters aboard.
Once again, the Druchii sail to distant shores for plunder and pillage. The mines of Naggaroth always hunger for fresh flesh!
They require no aid, and danger is but a fleeting thought. Their only cure is the exhilaration of unrestrained carnage.
Warriors devoid of mercy struggle for survival in the twisted streets of Naggaroth’s cities, most of whom are conscripted.
The Shadows glide ghostlike through petrified forests and jagged rocks. Even by Druchii standards, their existence is a living hell.
Competition for positions in the Dark Convent is both bloody and fierce. Only those who survive their ambition learn the most potent magic in the world.
The so-called masters of the Winds of Magic in the White Tower could never imagine that their every word is heard with perfect clarity in the shadows.
The ancient records of Ghrond contain secrets that could save—or end—lives.
Midnight demands offerings of vicious and vile sacrifices. Perhaps appeasing the gods will ensure our survival.
Beaten, starved, and endlessly worked, the slaves are exploited to the very limit of their endurance.
The High Elves exiled the Druchii, dividing them irreparably. Brother wars cannot mend the rift, and hatred festers eternally.
Malekith’s life is sustained by dark powers. The Witch King vows to witness the final Phoenix King’s downfall, even if it takes an eternity.
Death follows all who wield the Winds of Magic, but those attuned to Shyish are particularly adept at mastering the art of slaughter.
Most sorceresses dwell in absolute darkness, crafting cruel illusions to ensnare their prey and claim the souls they crave.

[[col:green]]You will confederate with the Thousand Maw.[[/col]]
[[col:green]]You will confederate with the Blessed Dread.[[/col]]
Tower of the Witch King||Seize seats within the Tower of the Witch King to dominate various aspects of Druchii society, ultimately subjugating other factions to your rule.
